alert.note: Alert for Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Chittenden County * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EDT, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Winooski, Shelburne and Colchester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Minor, poor drainage flooding of streets, underpasses, and low-lying areas is expected in the City of Burlington. This includes, but is not limited to portions of Pine Street, Lakeside Avenue, and areas along South Union Street. Some basement flooding is also possible. If encountering high water in a vehicle, turn around to avoid becoming stalled.
